msContents.summary: I) Nägär bäkämä konä ḥәywätu la-qәddus Yoḥannәs Mäṭmәq wa-ʾәfo konä mәträtä rәʾәsu, Discourse by John Chrysostom on the life and decollation of John the Baptist (fols. 3ra – 30rb, l.11) II) Homily by John Chrysostom on the glory of John the Baptist (fols. 30rb, l.12 – 41vb, l.9) III) Taʾāmra Yoḥannǝs Maṭmǝq “Miracles of John the Baptist”: 6 miracles (42ra – 50rb, l.13) IV) Mälkәʾa Yoḥannәs Mäṭmәq “Image of John the Baptist”: 27 strophes (50rb, l.15 – 54ra, l.8).

msItem.title: Discourse on the life and on the decollation of John the Baptist, ascribed to John Chrysostom (Nägär bäkämä konä ḥǝywätu la-qǝddusYoḥannǝs Maṭmǝq ... )
msItem.incipit: 3ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ዝንቱ፡ ነገር፡ በከመ፡ ኮነ፡ ሕይወቱ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ መጥምቅ፡ ወከመ፡ እፎ፡ ኮነ፡ እምትረተ[sic]፡ ርእሱ፡ ወተርጕሞ[sic]፨ ቅዱስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ በትርያክ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ብሂል፡ በሀገረ፡ ቍስጥ[3rb]ንጥያ[sic]፡ … 3ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. This (is) the discourse on the life of St John the Baptist and how the decapitation of his head happened. And St John Chrysostom interpreted it, the patriarch (and) head of the bishops, meaning - in the country of Constantinople …
msItem.explicit: 30rb, l.1: ... ወሶበ፡ ኮነ፡ አባ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ወሰማዕት፡ ረሰዩ፡ ሥጋሆሙ፡ ኅቡረ፨ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይምሐረነ፡ ለኵልነ፡ ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወለጸሐፊሁኒ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ወምስኪን፨ ወለዓመቱ [vac] ለዓ፨ ዓለ፨ አሜን፨ 30rb, l.1: ... and when ʾabbā Marqos was bishop and the martyrs placed their body together(??) May the Lord have compassion of us, of all of us, people of Christ, and even of his scribe, sinner and poor. And for his year... Forever and ever. Amen.

msItem.title: Homily on the glory of John the Baptist, ascribed to John Chrysostom (Dǝrsān za-däräsä Yoḥannǝs ʿAfä Warq … baʾǝnta kǝbru la-Yoḥannǝs Maṭmǝq)
msItem.incipit: 30rb, l.12: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩ድርሳን፡ ዘደረሰ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ዐፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ ካህን፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘቍስጥንጥን[s.l.]ያ: በእንተ፡ ክብሩ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ [30va]መጥምቅ፡ … 30rb, l.12: In the name of the Father and Son and Holy Spirit. This (is) one homily which the priest John Chrysostom, patriarch of Constantinople, composed on the glory of John the Baptist …
msItem.explicit: 41va, l.13: ...ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ነፍሳተ፡ አግብርቲሁ፡ [n.l.] [41vb]ወምስለ፡ አእማቲሁ፡ [vac.] ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አሜን። ወለጸሐፊሁኒ፡ አድኅነኒ፡ አምከራ[sic]፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ [vac.] ፨ ፨ ፨ 41va, l.13: ...and may his blessing be with the souls of his servants ... and with his maids ... forever and ever. Amen. And save also his scribe from the temptation of the body and the spirit.

msItem.title: Taʾāmra Yoḥannǝs Maṭmǝq “Miracles of John the Baptist”
msItem.incipit: 42ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ንቀድም፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጽሒፈ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ኮከበ፡ ዮርዶኖስ[sic]፡ ገዳም፡ ወማኅቶተ፡ ፄኖን፡ ቅሩበ፡ ሳፈም፡ ብርሃነ፡ ሰፉህ፡ ዓለም፨ [n.l.]እምሰብአ፡ ኅርመት፡ ኅሩም፨ ዘሰደደ፡ ለሥልጣነ፡ [n.l.]ፍትወት፡ ግረም፨ 42ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. We start, with the help of the Lord, the writing of his Miracles: the star of the monastery Yordanos, and lamp of Ḍenon, close to …, the light of the wide world. From the man of the illicit ceremony, which he banished, to the power of the terrible concupiscence. …
msItem.explicit: 50rb, l.3: ...ወአውደቆ፡ በጊዜሃ፡ ውስተ፡ ዓቢይ፡ ጸድፍ፡ ወሞተ፡ እኩየ፡ ሞተ፨ ወተአውቀት፡ ዛቲ፡ ተአምር፡ ውስተ፡ ኵሉ፡ በሐውርት፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሐሉ፡ ዓመቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ፨ ፨ ፨ 50rb, l.3: ... and in that moment he dropped him in a big precipice and he died, he died badly. And this miracle was revealed in all the regions. May his prayer and his blessing be [with] his maid Walatta Ṣādǝqān. Forever and ever. Amen.

msItem.title: Malkǝʾa Yoḥannǝs Maṭmǝq “Image of John the Baptist”
msItem.incipit: 50rb, l.15: በስመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ እሳት፡ በሐቅለ፡ ሕሊና፡ ነደዱ፨ ወበስመ፡ ማር[50va]ያም፡ ድንግል፡ መጥበቢተ፡ ዓለም፡ አባዲ፡ ማኅቶተ፡ ፀዳል፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ጽልመተ፡ አባሳ፡ ሰዳዲ፨... 50rb, l.15: In the name of the Lord, the fire burned in the field of the understanding and in the name of the virgin Mary, John, teacher of the ignorant world, lamp of light, persecuting the darkness of sin...
msItem.explicit: 53vb, l.16: ...እምእደ፡ መበለት፡ አሐቲ፡ ጸራይቀ፡ ፪ኤ። [54ra]ወለአመትከ፡ ወለተ፡ ኪዳን፡ አድህና፡ እመከራ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ፡ ሊተኒ፡ ለኃጥዕ፡ ገብርከ፡ ጸሐፊሁ፡ አቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ተፈጸመ፡ በሰላመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ አሜን: ፨ ፨ ፨ 53vb, l.16: ... from the hand of one nun two thin cakes. And to your maid Walatta Kidān, save her from the temptation of the body and the spirit; for your sinner servant, its scribe, ʾabuna Gabra Krǝstos, it was completed in the peace of the Lord Father. Amen.
